properties.areaDesc: North Central and Southeast Siskiyou County; South Central Siskiyou County
properties.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 13 at 3:31AM PST until January 16 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Medford OR
properties.description:
...EXTENDED PERIOD OF WINTER WEATHER CONTINUES...

.Two more systems will impact the region through Tuesday.
Significant snow accumulation will begin around 2000 feet today before
snow levels rise briefly this evening. Snow levels will then fall
to the valley floors Monday night. Snow will continue to
accumulate through Tuesday. Eventually, snow will taper off late
Tuesday evening. More snow will probably impact the Mt Shasta
region and Klamath Mountains late Wednesday and Wednesday night.

* WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total
snow accumulations of 4 to 9 inches. Winds gusting as high as 20
mph. For the Winter Storm Watch above 3000 feet, heavy snow
possible. Total snow accumulations of 12 to 20 inches possible.
Winds could gust as high as 25 mph.

* WHERE...South Central Siskiyou County and Southeast Siskiyou
County, including Mount Shasta City, Dunsmuir, McCloud,
Medicine Lake, Interstate 5, and Highway 89.

* WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 4 AM Monday to 10
AM PST Tuesday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Wednesday
afternoon through Thursday morning.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous
conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Gusty
winds could bring down tree branches.

* View the hazard area in detail at
https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/mfr/HAZARD
properties.instruction:
* Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination.

* Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and
limited visibilities.

* See https://www.tripcheck.com or http://quickmap.dot.ca.gov
for latest road conditions.

* A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow
will cause travel difficulties.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST TUESDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING ABOVE 3000 FEET
